purlwise wyib k2 pass the slipped st over the first two sts on your rn* repeat from * to * once more sl3 purlwise wyif 1 st increase d = 13 sts row 32 k3 k until 3 sts remain sl3 purlwise wyif please read all the instructions below until the straight portion section before continuing with the increases continue in this manner increasing 1 st every other rs row and alternating the increases between the right and the left edges placing them after the 3-st i-cord at the right edge and before the 3-st i-cord at the left edge right-edge increases at the beginning of the row after the 3-st i-cord work left leaning increases m1l knit if the new st in the textured stitch pattern is a knit stitch or m1lp if the new st is a purl stitch left-edge increases at the end of the row before the 3-st i-cord work right leaning increases m1r knit if the new st in the textured stitch pattern is a knit stitch or m1rp if the new st is a purl stitch once 2 knit sts have been increased at either the right or left edge they should be worked into the stitch pattern continue working the increases until you have a total of 37 sts on your needles 31 sts for the textured stitch pattern plus 3 i-cord sts on each side or until the piece reaches your desired width for proper alignment and symmetry the final stitch count excluding the i-cord stitches should be a multiple of 3 sts plus 1 st as the first stitch after the beginning i-cord and the last stitch before the ending i-cord must be a purl stitch i recommend using the increases check sheet table on page 9 to keep track of the increases
